text.1: The beginning of this verse consists of hijaiah letters, as found at the beginning of several other surahs. The commentators of the Quran have differing opinions regarding the meaning of these letters. For further information, please refer to "Al-Qur'an dan Tafsirnya" Volume I, specifically the commentary on the first verse of Surah al-Baqarah.
text.2: Allah swears by the Holy Quran, which clarifies guidance and direction, and explains the things that people need in this world and the hereafter to achieve happiness. Whoever follows the guidelines that have been outlined in the Quran will be fortunate and safe, and whoever deviates from it will be at a loss and stray from the right path.
text.3:
Allah explains that He has made the Qur'an in Arabic, not in 'Ajam (foreign languages), because those who will be given the first warning are the Arabs, so that they can easily understand the lessons and advice contained within it, and they can easily contemplate its meaning and significance. He did not send down the Qur'an in 'Ajam so that they would have no excuse to say how they could understand the contents of the Qur'an because its language is not Arabic, our language, as Allah says:

And if We had made it a Qur'an in other than Arabic, they would have said, "Why are its verses not explained in detail? Is it [a book in] a foreign language and [He] an Arab?" Say, "It is, for those who believe, a guidance and cure." (Fussilat/41: 44)
text.4:
Allah explains the position of the Qur'an in Lauh Mahfudz, that it has existed in His eternal knowledge, of very high value because it contains secrets and wisdoms that explain human happiness, and guidance that leads them to the right path. This is in accordance with Allah's word:

And indeed, it is a noble Qur'an, in a Register well-protected (Lauh Mahfudz), none touch it except the purified. A revelation from the Lord of the worlds. (al-Waqi'ah/56: 77-80)
text.5:
Allah reproaches the polytheists of Mecca by saying: Should We then desist from warning you with the Qur'an because you are so deeply entrenched in your disbelief, constantly abandoning Our commands and committing Our prohibitions? No! We will never do such a thing, because of Our mercy and compassion towards you, even though you deserve to be destroyed, or left to stray until death, because your actions are excessive and transgressing the limits.

Qatadah said, "If the Qur'an had been withdrawn or abolished when it was rejected by the first people of the previous nations, then they would surely have been destroyed, but Allah always bestows His mercy and compassion upon them, and Muhammad (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) continuously called them for more than twenty years according to the permission and will of Allah."
text.6:
In this verse, Allah consoles His Messenger Muhammad (peace and blessings be upon him), who was grieving because he was denied by his people, and Allah commands him to be patient. Not a few messengers who had been sent by Allah since ancient times were denied and mocked by their people, just as he was denied and mocked.

Such is the Sunnatullah, which is a decree from Allah that cannot be changed, as Allah says:

"According to the sunnah of Allah for those who passed on before; and you will never find in the sunnah of Allah any change." (al-Ahzab/33: 62)
text.7:
In this verse, Allah consoles His Messenger Muhammad, peace be upon him, who is grieving because he is being rejected by his people, and Allah commands him to be patient. Not a few messengers who were sent by Allah in the past were denied and mocked by their people just as he is being denied and mocked.

Such is the Sunnatullah, which is a decree from Allah that cannot be changed, as Allah says:

[It is] the established way of Allah for those who passed on before; and you will not find in the way of Allah any change. (al-Ahzab/33: 62)
text.8:
Allah explains that He destroyed those who denied the messengers, and they could not escape or avoid when the disaster came, even though they were far stronger and more powerful than the people of Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him). This should be a matter of concern for the Ummah of Muhammad. Allah says:

"Have they not travelled through the earth and seen what was the end of those before them? They were more numerous than them and greater in strength and in the traces (they left) in the land." (Ghafir/40: 82)

This verse is concluded with a warning to the Ummah of Muhammad that Allah's decree that applied to the people who denied the messengers should be a lesson for them, because it is not impossible that they too will be afflicted with disaster as were the previous people. Allah says:

"Then We made them a precedent and an example for later generations." (az-Zukhruf/43: 56)

Allah also says:

"That is the way of Allah which has passed on among His servants." (Ghafir/40: 85)
text.9:
This verse is addressed by Allah to His Messenger, that if he asks the polytheists among his people, who created the universe such as the heavens, the earth, and everything else, they will unequivocally answer that all of it was created by Allah, the Almighty Lord, the All-Knowing of everything, nothing is hidden from Him. Allah says:

"From Allah, nothing is hidden on the earth or in the heaven." (Ali 'Imran/3: 5)
text.10:
Allah explains that He is the One who made the earth as a carpet and prepared it for His creatures as a place for them to settle, stand, and move their feet, equipped with roads so that they can visit from one place to another, both near and far, for the sake of life and livelihood, economic and trade interests, and others. In line with this verse is Allah's statement:

"Have We not made the earth a resting place?" (an-Naba'/78: 6)

Allah's statement:

"And We placed therein broad pathways that they might find their way." (al-Anbiya'/21: 31)
text.11:
Allah sends down rain from the sky according to the necessity for enlivening plants and vegetation. He sends down rain neither more than is needed, so that it does not overflow beyond limits and ultimately become a disaster, like a flood that destroys and annihilates, nor too little, so that it does not suffice for the fertility of plants and vegetation, causing them to dry up and wither, and resulting in famine disasters that befall Allah's creatures everywhere.

With the descent of rain from the sky according to the necessary measure, the land that was dead, no longer grown with plants and trees, lives and prospers. Just as Allah is able to revive the dead land, so too is He able to revive and bring forth the dead from the graves in a living state, as Allah says:

And of His signs is that He sends down rain from the sky and gives life thereby to the earth after its lifelessness. (ar-Rum/30: 24)

And His saying:

And it is He who sends the winds as good tidings before His mercy, until when they have carried a heavy cloud, We drive it to a dead land and We send down rain therein and bring forth thereby [some] of all fruits. Thus will We bring forth the dead; perhaps you will be reminded. (Fathir/35: 9)

What is presented by this verse is proven by the science discovered by humans today. It is estimated that in one second, as much as 16 million tons of water evaporate from the earth. Using this figure, it is calculated that there are 513 trillion tons of water that evaporate from the earth in a year. This figure turns out to be the same as the calculation regarding the amount of rainwater that falls in a year. Thus, water performs a balanced circulation continuously. Life on earth is highly dependent on the sustainability of this water cycle. Although many technologies try to intervene in this natural cycle, such as making artificial rain, in reality the water cycle cannot be made artificially.

The proportion of rainwater is not only important in terms of quantity, but also the speed at which raindrops fall [according to the required size]. The speed of raindrops does not exceed the standard speed, no matter how large the raindrops are. Generally, raindrops have a diameter of 4.5 mm. Its speed is about 8 meters per second. At smaller sizes, of course, the speed is lower. At droplet sizes larger than 4.5 mm, it does not mean that the speed is higher. The speed remains, which is about 8 meters per second. This is because the shape of the liquid droplets will interact with the air and wind so that the shape of the water droplets changes in such a way that the falling speed decreases and does not exceed the standard speed.

Reviving the dead land with water (rain) from the sky has been stated in Surah Fussilat/41: 39, that when rain is sent down in a barren area, the area will (can, by the will of Allah) be grown with trees. This verse emphasizes that water from the sky is sent down according to a certain measure. The resurrection of humans after the realm of the grave is often likened to reviving barren land with rainwater. This analogy can be compared to the growth of seeds or wild spores carried by the wind and scattered on dry land. If this dry land receives sufficient rain [according to the required measure], the seeds will grow into sprouts and then into plants. If the rainfall is very heavy, the seeds or spores that become the seeds of plants will be washed away by the flow of water. Even if the flow of water does not wash away, but if the moisture content of the water in the soil is too excessive, the seeds will not grow into sprouts, but will rot. Everything according to measure.
text.12:
Among the attributes of Allah mentioned in this verse is that He is the One who created all creatures in pairs, male and female, male and female, whether from the types of plants, trees, fruits, flowers, and others, or from the types of animals and humans. He also made vehicles in the form of boats, ships that can be used to transport people and merchandise at sea, and livestock, such as camels, horses, donkeys, cows, and others that can be used as means of transportation on land, and others that can connect one place to another, both on land and at sea with various means of transportation.

This is in accordance with Allah's word:

"And (He has created) horses, mules, and donkeys for you to ride and (as) adornment. And Allah creates what you do not know." (an-Nahl/16: 8)

An explanation regarding Allah creating everything in pairs can be seen in the explanation in Surah asy-Syura/42: 11. Several other verses that discuss the same matter are Yasin/36: 36, ar-Ra'd/13: 3, and adh-dzariyat/51: 49.
text.13:
In this verse, Allah explains that when humans are on the backs of animals, boats, ships, trains, airplanes, and so on, they should remember the blessings that Allah has bestowed upon them, glorify Allah, and purify Him from the unworthy attributes attributed to Him by the polytheists. They should recite this verse as a prayer:

"Glory to Him Who has subjected this to us, and we could never have accomplished it (of our own accord). And surely, to our Lord we are about to return!" (az-Zukhruf/43: 13-14)

If Allah had not subjected the universe with the knowledge He bestowed, humans would not be able to do it, because it is beyond their capabilities.

The recitation of this prayer reminds humans to always be prepared for the Day of Judgment when all humans will face and experience it, and not to neglect remembering Allah, whether traveling or not, whether sailing or staying in their hometown.

In connection with the above commentary, it is narrated by Imam Muslim, Abu Dawud, and an-Nasa'i that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him), when traveling and riding, would say three times and recite the prayer above.

When the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him) rode his mount to undertake a journey, he would say *takbir* three times. Then he would recite, "Glory to Him Who has subjected this to us, and we could never have accomplished it (of our own accord). And surely, to our Lord we are about to return!" (Narrated by Muslim, Abu Dawud, and an-Nasa'i)

The verse above teaches that humans should be grateful for Allah's blessings in the form of animals and treat them well. Equality among creatures, especially between animals and humans, is strongly emphasized by God. One of the verses below explains that animals are also communities of God, just like humans. Although they have different characteristics, specificities, and systems, in essence, they are the same as humans in the eyes of God. And humans are obliged to remember this.

"There is not an animal on earth, nor a bird that flies on its two wings, but they are communities like you. We have not neglected anything in the Book, then to their Lord they will be gathered." (al-An'am/6: 38)

Several verses of the Qur'an mention animals, including how humans should treat animals, the usefulness of animals to humans, animal behavior that humans should emulate, and much more. In this relationship of equality between creatures, there is a writing by a wise man, Muhammad Fazlur Rahman Ansari, which reads as follows, "Everything on earth is created for us, so it is our natural obligation to: protect everything from damage; utilize it while maintaining its dignity as a creation of God; preserve it as much as possible, thereby being grateful for God's blessings in the form of concrete actions."

Regarding pets or livestock, the Qur'an in Surah an-Nahl/16: 5 mentions several benefits of animals for humans:

"And the cattle, He has created them for you. In them there is warmth (clothing), and numerous benefits, and of them you eat." (an-Nahl/16: 5)

In connection with the verse from Surah an-Nahl above, we must pay attention that, for example, the skin and fur of livestock can be utilized. However, the Prophet Muhammad (peace and blessings be upon him) continued with something very wise. He forbade the use of wild animal skins, even just as floor coverings. If this rule or appeal made by the Prophet is obeyed by everyone, then the senseless killing of some types of wild animals for the sake of profit alone will certainly not occur. Likewise, even though Muslims are allowed to consume the meat of certain animals, it must be remembered that this does not justify cruel and uncontrolled slaughter against them.

One of the benefits of animals is as a means of transportation. We must remember that the Arabs in the past were completely dependent on camels to help carry goods on journeys. God states this in the verse below:

"And they carry your loads to a land which you could not reach except with great hardship. Indeed, your Lord is Kind and Merciful. And (He has created) horses, mules, and donkeys for you to ride and (as) adornment. And Allah creates what you do not know." (an-Nahl/16: 7-8)

In essence, Islam teaches its followers to love animals and preserve their lives. In the Qur'an, Allah emphasizes that He has bestowed upon humans a domain of power that encompasses everything in this world.

"And He has subjected to you all that is in the heavens and all that is on the earth; it is all from Him." (al-Jatsiyah/45: 13).

In this verse, the Qur'an does not at all indicate that humans have absolute power to do as they please with everything in the heavens and on earth. Nor do they have unlimited rights to use nature in a way that damages its ecological balance.

"....it is all from Him...." This fragment of the verse should be realized and understood as a reminder from God, that humans own nothing in this world. So how we should treat other people's belongings should always be remembered in the minds of "...those who think...."

Islam basically does not support humans to misuse animals for sports purposes or to make animals objects of arbitrary experiments. This verse reminds mankind that the Creator has made everything in nature (including animals) as a trust that they must protect.

text.15:
Allah explains that even though the polytheists acknowledge that Allah created the heavens and the earth, they also assert that Allah has a child, and that the angels are His daughters.

They say that Allah is not eternal like creation, both having children, even degrading Him because Allah is said to have daughters, while they have sons. The Arabs at that time considered those who had daughters to be humiliated. Therefore, it is not surprising that the verse is closed with a firm statement that mankind is truly ungrateful for the blessings of God that have been bestowed upon them.
text.16:
Allah unveils the veil of misguidance of the polytheists and the falsehood of their words. Is it reasonable that Allah possesses something worse for Himself (according to their assumption) while others possess the good and choose daughters for Himself, while for others, sons? Allah's word:

"Is it for you the males and for Him the females?

That is then an unjust division." (an-Najm/53: 21-22)

And His word:

"Has He (Allah) chosen daughters rather than sons? What is the matter with you? How do you judge? Then will you not remember?" (ash-Shaffat/37: 153-155)

And His word again:

"Had Allah willed to take a son, He could have chosen whom He willed of what He has created. Exalted is He. He is Allah, the One, the Prevailing." (az-Zumar/39: 4)
text.17:
Allah demonstrates the foolishness and deceit of the polytheists. When one of them is blessed with a daughter, his face immediately becomes very gloomy with sadness, bearing deep shame, unable to face his friends. He isolates himself in confusion. What should he do? Should he leave the daughter as she is, even though he must bear shame and humiliation, or should he bury her alive? A most despicable act, as Allah says:

And when one of them is informed of [the birth of] a female, his face becomes dark, and he suppresses [his rage]. He hides himself from the people because of the ill of which he has been informed. Should he keep it in humiliation or bury it in the ground? Unquestionably, evil is what they decide. (an-Nahl/16: 58-59)
text.18: Allah refutes the polytheists' assumption that Allah has daughters while they have sons. The refutation is: Is one who is born and raised to adorn themselves, and when they are in exchange of ideas and discussion, is unable to present a strong argument or reason, because they are more influenced by feelings than using intellect and thought, is such a person worthy of being considered a child of God?
text.19:
This verse explains that the polytheists have committed four major errors that demonstrate their disbelief. First, they said that Allah has a child; second, Allah's children are female; and third, Allah's children are angels, whereas angels are His honored servants, who constantly worship God day and night, and never disobey what is commanded to them. They said that angels who are like that are female. Fourth, their assumption that they became polytheists because it was destined by Allah. All their statements are great sins and baseless lies.

Did they witness the creation of the angels so that they dared to determine such a thing and be sure that the angels are female? Allah says:

*Or did We create the angels as females while they were witnesses? Verily, it is of their falsehood that they say: "Allah has begotten." And indeed, they are liars!* (as-Saffat/37: 150-152)

Verse 19 is closed with a threat to the polytheists that what they say about the angels will all be recorded and they will be held accountable for it in the Hereafter.

One more misguided act of the polytheists is revealed. They said in a mocking tone, "If Allah, the Most Gracious, had willed, we would not have worshipped those angels." As if they worshipped the angels because of Allah's will. Allah says:

*Those who associate partners with Allah will say: "If Allah had willed, we would not have associated anything with Him."* (al-An'am/6: 148)

Their stance is very wrong and misguided, because Allah never approves of worship of anything other than Him. Allah only commands that people worship Him alone, as He says:

*And We certainly sent to every nation a messenger, [saying], "Worship Allah and avoid ṭāghūt."* (an-Nahl/16: 36)

And His saying:

*And ask those of Our messengers whom We sent before you: "Did We ever appoint gods to be worshipped besides the Most Gracious?"* (az-Zukhruf/43: 45)

Verse 20 is closed with a firm statement, rejecting the words of the polytheists, that they do not know the actual situation at all and have no knowledge whatsoever about it. What they say is only conjecture and is not based on truth and righteousness.
